comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Franz Reiterer (born 1889, Austrian) was the chief pilot of the HBF (Hansa-Brandenburgische Flugzeugwerke). He flew several world records in 1915. On October 21, 1915 he died because of a plane crash. A wing was broken off in the air and Franz Reiterer and his companion Bela Mogan from the Austrian Air Corps were killed instantly. (according to www.maerkischeallgemeine.de/mazarchiv/detail.php?article_... and www.maerkischeallgemeine.de/mazarchiv/detail.php?article_..., in German).
